title: Coroner: Child accidentally shot, killed at Lexington home identified
content:
The 13-year-old child who was accidentally shot and killed on Wednesday at a home in Lexington has been identified by the Lexington County Coroner’s Office.
Coroner Earl Wells said Ethan Payne, 13, of Lexington, died after sustaining a single gunshot wound.
Wells said Payne was transported to a local hospital following the incident where he was pronounced dead at 3:30 p.m.
Lt. Matt Davis, a department spokesman, said the child was at home with friends at 3 p.m. – after school was let out for a half-day – when the gun was fired, fatally wounding Payne.
Payne was an eighth-grader at Lexington Middle School.
Parents with children at Lexington Middle School were informed of the ‘tragic death of one of our eighth-grade students’ in an email from Principal Ryan Pool. Counselors and psychologists were on hand Thursday to talk to the 13-year-old’s classmates and teachers.
“During school, we will carefully watch all our students. We will listen to their comments, answer general questions and look for signs of distress,” parents were informed. Parents were also provided suggestions on how to handle concerns their children may express.
An investigation continues into the accidental shooting. Davis said investigators found a gun safe in the home and it is unclear how the firearm was accessible.
Wells said the coroner’s office and the police department will continue to investigate the incident.
